text: Marcgravia grandifolia is a species of plant in the Marcgraviaceae family. It is endemic to Ecuador. ==Ecology== The plant's natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. The green-crowned brilliant hummingbird feeds at the large inflorescences of the Marcgravia grandifolia vine. ==References== grandifolia Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador Category:Endangered plants Category:Bird food plants Category:Vines Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Marcgravia grandifolia
